post.desc: Okay, so when you wear a kimono 👘 you're supposed to wrap your left side over your right. This puts the right side in front of the left side **as viewed by other people**, hence the name 右前 (Migimae). Doing the opposite here – 左前 (Hidarimae), where **you** can see the left side is over the right – is taboo since it's reserved for the dead.
